notes.short:
This file describes common register and command codes.

These are defined in ranges separate from the per-service ones.
No service actually derives from this file, but services can include packets
defined here.
Their code is listed as say `@ intensity` and not `@ 0x01` (the spectool enforces that).
notes.commands:
Command codes are subdivided as follows:
* Commands `0x000-0x07f` - common to all services
* Commands `0x080-0xeff` - defined per-service
* Commands `0xf00-0xfff` - reserved for implementation

Commands follow.
notes.registers:
Register codes are subdivided as follows:
* Registers `0x001-0x07f` - r/w common to all services
* Registers `0x080-0x0ff` - r/w defined per-service
* Registers `0x100-0x17f` - r/o common to all services
* Registers `0x180-0x1ff` - r/o defined per-service
* Registers `0x200-0xeff` - custom, defined per-service
* Registers `0xf00-0xfff` - reserved for implementation, should not be seen on the wire

The types listed are typical. Check spec for particular service for exact type,
and a service-specific name for a register (eg. `value` could be `pulse_length`).
All registers default to `0` unless otherwise indicated.
notes.events:
Events codes are 8-bit and are subdivided as follows:
* Events `0x00-0x7f` - common to all services
* Events `0x80-0xff` - defined per-service

packets.name: announce
packets.description:
Enumeration data for control service; service-specific advertisement data otherwise.
Control broadcasts it automatically every 500ms, but other service have to be queried to provide it.

packets.name: announce
packets.description:
Enumeration data for control service; service-specific advertisement data otherwise.
Control broadcasts it automatically every 500ms, but other service have to be queried to provide it.

packets.name: get_register
packets.description:
Registers number `N` is fetched by issuing command `0x1000 | N`.
The report format is the same as the format of the register.

packets.name: get_register
packets.description:
Registers number `N` is fetched by issuing command `0x1000 | N`.
The report format is the same as the format of the register.

packets.name: set_register
packets.description:
Registers number `N` is set by issuing command `0x2000 | N`, with the format
the same as the format of the register.

packets.name: event
packets.description: Event from sensor or a broadcast service.

packets.name: calibrate
packets.description: Request to calibrate a sensor. The report indicates the calibration is done.

packets.name: calibrate
packets.description: Request to calibrate a sensor. The report indicates the calibration is done.

packets.name: intensity
packets.description: This is either binary on/off (0 or non-zero), or can be gradual (eg. brightness of an RGB LED strip).

packets.name: value
packets.description: The primary value of actuator (eg. servo pulse length, or motor duty cycle).

packets.name: max_power
packets.description: Limit the power drawn by the service, in mA.

packets.name: streaming_samples
packets.description:
Asks device to stream a given number of samples
(clients will typically write `255` to this register every second or so, while streaming is required).

packets.name: streaming_interval
packets.description: Period between packets of data when streaming in milliseconds.

packets.name: reading
packets.description: Read-only value of the sensor, also reported in streaming.

packets.name: min_reading
packets.description: The lowest value that can be reported by the sensor.

packets.name: max_reading
packets.description: The highest value that can be reported by the sensor.

packets.name: reading_error
packets.description:
The real value of whatever is measured is between `reading - reading_error` and `reading + reading_error`. It should be computed from the internal state of the sensor. This register is often, but not always `const`. If the register value is modified,
send a report in the same frame of the ``reading`` report.

packets.name: reading_resolution
packets.description: Smallest, yet distinguishable change in reading.

packets.name: low_threshold
packets.description: Threshold when reading data gets low and triggers a ``low``.

packets.name: high_threshold
packets.description: Thresholds when reading data gets high and triggers a ``high`` event.

packets.name: streaming_preferred_interval
packets.description: Preferred default streaming interval for sensor in milliseconds.

packets.name: variant
packets.description:
The hardware variant of the service.
For services which support this, there's an enum defining the meaning.

packets.name: status_code
packets.description:
Reports the current state or error status of the device. ``code`` is a standardized value from 
the Jacdac status/error codes. ``vendor_code`` is any vendor specific error code describing the device
state. This report is typically not queried, when a device has an error, it will typically
add this report in frame along with the announce packet.

packets.name: instance_name
packets.description: A friendly name that describes the role of this service instance in the device.

packets.name: active
packets.description: Notifies that the service has been activated (eg. button pressed, network connected, etc.)

packets.name: inactive
packets.description: Notifies that the service has been dis-activated.

packets.name: change
packets.description: Notifies that the some state of the service changed.

packets.name: status_code_changed
packets.description: Notifies that the status code of the service changed.

packets.name: low
packets.description: Notifies that the low threshold has been crossed

packets.name: high
packets.description: Notifies that the high threshold has been crossed

packets.name: neutral
packets.description: Notifies that the threshold is back between ``low`` and ``high``.
